# How to install {% if packageConfig.shortName and packageWebsiteConfig.preferShortName == "true" %}{{packageConfig.shortName}}{% else %}the {{longXpackName}}{% endif %}

{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCustomUserInformation == "true" %}
<CustomInstall nodeVersion={frontMatter.node_version}/>
{% else %}
## Prerequisites

A recent [Node.js](https://nodejs.org) (>=**{{packageEnginesNodeVersion}}**),
since the TypeScript code
is compiled into ECMAScript 2020 code, and the tests use ES6 modules.

## Install

The package is available as
[`{{packageScopedName}}`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/{{packageScopedName}}/)
from the public [`npmjs`](https://www.npmjs.com) repository;
it can be added as a
{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli != "true" %}dependency to any TypeScript or JavaScript{% else %}development dependency to any **npm**{% endif %}
project.

The command to install the
**latest** available version of **{{packageScopedName}}** is:

```sh
npm install {{packageScopedName}}@latest{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli == "true" %} --save-dev{% endif %}
```

To install a **specific version**, mention it explicitly:

<CodeBlock language="sh"> {
`npm install {{packageScopedName}}@{{releaseVersion}}{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli == "true" %} --save-dev{% endif %}
`} </CodeBlock>

{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli != "true" %}
The package does not provide any executables, and generally there are **no
reasons to install it globally**.{% else %}
The package does provides executables, and can also
be installed globally.

The command to install the
**latest** available version of **{{packageScopedName}}** globally is:

```sh
npm install --location=global {{packageScopedName}}@latest
```

To install a **specific version**, mention it explicitly:

<CodeBlock language="sh"> {
`npm install --location=global {{packageScopedName}}@{{releaseVersion}}
`} </CodeBlock>

{% endif %}

## Uninstall

As any **npm** package, **{{packageScopedName}}** can be uninstalled
from the project and the dependency removed from `package.json` with:

```console
npm uninstall {{packageScopedName}}
```

{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli == "true" %}
If installed globally, it can be uninstalled with:

```console
npm uninstall --location=global {{packageScopedName}}
```

{% endif %}
{% endif %}
